title: Raheem Sterling trains separately to rest of England squad as Man City star recovers from Liverpool clash

Raheem Sterling trained separately to the rest of the England squad on Tuesday as the Three Lions prepare for Wednesday's friendly against Germany. 
The Manchester City star is recovering from his side's Premier League clash against Liverpool and trained indoors while the other players were put through their paces on grass at St George's Park. 
Sterling played the full 90 minutes at the Etihad in a pulsating game which saw the two sides share the spoils with a 1-1 draw. 
Adam Lallana, who is also part of the Three Lions squad, missed a gilt-edged chance to seal all three points for the Reds but failed to make a telling contact with the goal at his mercy. The Three Lions at St George's Park (Photo: The FA via Getty) Jake Livermore, Gary Cahill and Jamie Vardy (Photo: Getty) England boss Gareth Southgate (Photo: The FA via Getty) 
Defensive duo John Stones and Nathaniel Clyne also featured at the Etihad and are part of Gareth Southgate's party for the trip to Germany and the qualifier against Lithuania at Wembley on Sunday. 
Jamie Vardy trained with teammates after he revealed he had received death threats for his supposed role in the sacking of Claudio Ranieri from Leicester. 
Vardy's goals fired the Foxes to the most unlikely title triumph in history in 2015-16 but failed to replicate his form this season as Leicester were sucked into a relegation battle. 
But he, and his side, have turned a corner since Ranieri's sacking, pulling away from the bottom three. Tom Heaton makes a save (Photo: The FA via Getty) Nathan Redmond and Nathaniel Clyne (Photo: The FA via Getty) Read More Gareth Southgate showed England stars his Euro 96 penalty miss as part of rousing speech 
Vardy said: “The story is out there and people pick it up and jump on it and you’re getting death threats about your family, kids, everything. 
“To be honest I get them (death threats) every week. On social media, you name it – walking down the street. Football fans don’t seem to like me. 
“I just get on with it but when people are trying to cut your missus up while she’s driving along, with the kids in the back of the car. It’s not the best. It’s happened plenty of times. 
“It is terrifying. All that can happen is they get banned on twitter. People get cut up but if there’s no cameras you’re screwed.” poll loading Who will win when England play Germany? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
